PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [47c1da2ff4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17355/commits/47c1da2ff41b4db3042d78813f1ba5fc08004b0b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension`
`+ constCompWhiskeringLeftIso`
`+ isColimitCoconeOfIsLeftKanExtension`
`+ lanCompColimIso`
`+ ranCompLimIso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Input on how to maybe speed up compilation time welcome :shrug:
Also I *think* I've made the universes as general as possible, but a second pair of :eyes: wouldn't hurt

These is a more general construction, given `F'` a left Kan extension of `F` along `L`, then any colimit cocone for `F` gives a colimit cocone for `F'`:
```lean
variable (F' : D  H) {L : C  D} {F : C  H} ( : F  L  F') [F'.IsLeftKanExtension ]

@[simps]
noncomputable def coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension (c : Cocone F) : Cocone F' where
  pt := c.pt
   := F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension  _ c.

def isColimitCoconeOfIsLeftKanExtension {c : Cocone F} (hc : IsColimit c) :
    IsColimit (F'.coconeOfIsLeftKanExtension  c) where
  desc s := hc.desc (Cocone.mk _ (  whiskerLeft L s.))
  fac s := by
    have : F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension  ((const D).obj c.pt) c.  
        (Functor.const _).map
          (hc.desc (Cocone.mk _ (  whiskerLeft L s.))) = s. :=
      F'.hom_ext_of_isLeftKanExtension  _ _ (by aesop_cat)
    exact congr_app this
  uniq s m hm := hc.hom_ext (fun j  by
    have := hm (L.obj j)
    nth_rw 1 [ F'.descOfIsLeftKanExtension_fac_app  ((const D).obj c.pt)]
    dsimp at this 
    rw [assoc, this, IsColimit.fac, NatTrans.comp_app, whiskerLeft_app])
```
Then, `lanCompColimIso` should be redefined as `NatIso.ofComponents` of the isomorphisms obtained by `coconePointUniqueUpToIso` using suitable colimit cocones.
Thanks! I thought about attempting that generality but I was kind of afraid of the naturality proof, but maybe I'm too pessimistic. Will try your approach.
Are you sure the naturality can be proven if we use `coconePointUniqueUpToIso`? I feel like we lack coherence if we don't construct the iso explicitely.
Ah, nvm, I think it is possible :grin:

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/KanExtension): Composing `lan` with `colim`
